snippet: An electrical device glued to the scalp can slow cancer growth and prolong survival in people with the deadliest type of brain tumor, glioblastoma, researchers have found.
abstract: Researchers report that electrical device glued to scalp can slow cancer growth and prolong survival in people with deadliest type of brain tumor, called glioblastomas; device, produced by British company Novocure, is not cure and on average adds only a few more months of life when paired with standard regimen of surgery, radiation and chemotherapy; findings were presented at meeting of Society for Neuro-Oncology.
lead_paragraph: An electrical device glued to the scalp can slow cancer growth and prolong survival in people with the deadliest type of brain tumor, glioblastoma, researchers have found.

headline.main: Electrical Scalp Device Can Slow Progression of Deadly Brain Tumors
headline.print_headline: Electrical Scalp Device for Deadliest Brain Tumors Can Prolong Survival
